page.title: 06Brigstock Country Park
page.content: Situated on the eastern side of the village, Northants County Council bought the old sand pit workings. It was derelict land with some water but no trees. The site was 32 acres, and 5 of these acres are being used for the new by-pass. Hawthorn trees are being planted, meadow, grass, picnic areas and a car park. The new by-pass will have a service road to it. Trees will be planted by schools and the WI. Hopefully wild life, insects etc, will flourish and there will be a nature walk through{Fermyn Woods.}Wildlife found in the area: pheasant, french partridge, collared dove, rabbits, hares, foxes, weasels and some deer. During the 1939-45 war American troops stationed in Boughton Park accidentally released the Dukes herd of deer which took to the woods and footprints betray their presence today
